I've read the FAQ and the javadocs and done much web searching but can't find
an answer to this.  Sorry if this is stupid question.

I need to write a test case that tests a class whose behavior depends on
a System property.  The class reads the System property at class initialization
time.  I'd like to have multiple test cases, each of which sets a different
value for the System property, so each of the tests needs to be run in a
separate JVM or possibly a separate ClassLoader.

Is there a simple way to (e.g.) annotate my test case to cause JUnit to
handle this for me?

I'm invoking JUnit as part of a maven build.  Note that I don't want to
run *all* of my JUnit tests in a single separate JVM, I want to run
certain test cases each in their own separate JVM (or ClassLoader).

If I have to start a new JVM or create a new ClassLoader myself, what's
the best way to initialize the CLASSPATH and find the class to be tested
from within a JUnit test case running under maven?

Thanks.
